api_key.description: The API key for Permit.io API (Required)

timeout.description: Timeout for the requests to Permit.io API - default is 10 seconds

environment_id.description: Unique id of the environment that owns the condition set rule

id.description: Unique id of the condition set rule

organization_id.description: Unique id of the organization that owns the condition set rule

permission.description: The permission that will be granted to the userset on the resourceset. The permission can be either a resource action id, or {resource_key}:{action_key}, i.e: the "permission name".

project_id.description: Unique id of the project that owns the condition set rule

resource_set.description: The resourceset that represents the resources that are granted for access, i.e: all the resources matching this rule can be accessed by the userset to perform the granted permission

user_set.description: The userset that will be given permission, i.e: all the users matching this rule will be given the specified permission

block.description: See [our documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Condition-Set-Rules) for more information on condition sets rules.

auth_mechanism.description:
Default: "Bearer"
Enum: "Bearer" "Basic" "Headers"
Proxy config auth mechanism will define the authentication mechanism that will be used to authenticate the request.

Bearer injects the secret into the Authorization header as a Bearer token,

Basic injects the secret into the Authorization header as a Basic user:password,

Headers injects plain headers into the request.

auth_secret.description: Proxy config secret is set to enable the Permit Proxy to make proxied requests to the backend service.

environment_id.description: Unique id of the environment that owns the proxy config

id.description: Unique id of the proxy config

key.description: Proxy Config is set to enable the Permit Proxy to make proxied requests as part of the Frontend AuthZ.

mapping_rules.description: Proxy config mapping rules will include the rules that will be used to map the request to the backend service by a URL and a http method.

name.description: The name of the proxy config, for example: 'Stripe API

organization_id.description: Unique id of the organization that owns the proxy config

project_id.description: Unique id of the project that owns the proxy config

block.description: See [the documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Proxy-Config/operation/create_proxy_config) for more information about proxy configs.

created_at.description: The creation timestamp. This is a timestamp for when the object was created.

description.description: The description. This is a human-readable description for the object.

environment_id.description: The environment ID. This is a unique identifier for the environment.

id.description: The resource ID. This is a unique identifier for the resource.

key.description: The key. This is a unique identifier.

name.description: The name. This is a human-readable name for the object.

object_resource.description: The object resource ID or key

organization_id.description: The organization ID. This is a unique identifier for the organization.

project_id.description: The project ID. This is a unique identifier for the project.

subject_resource.description: The subject resource ID or key

updated_at.description: The update timestamp. This is a timestamp for when the object was last updated.

block.description: See [the documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Resource-Relations/operation/create_resource_relation) for more information about Relations

actions.description:
A actions definition block, typically contained within a resource type definition block.
    The actions represents the ways you can interact with a protected resource.

attributes.description: Attributes that each resource of this type defines, and can be used in your ABAC policies.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the resource was created

description.description: An optional longer description of what this resource respresents in your system

environment_id.description: Unique id of the environment that owns the resource

key.description: A URL-friendly name of the resource (i.e: slug). You will be able to query later using this key instead of the id (UUID) of the resource.

organization_id.description: Unique id of the organization that owns the resource

project_id.description: Unique id of the project that owns the resource

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the resource was last updated

urn.description: The URN (Uniform Resource Name) of the resource

block.description: See [the documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Resources/operation/create_resource) for more information about resources.

conditions.description: a boolean expression that consists of multiple conditions, with and/or logic.

description.description: an optional longer description of the set

environment_id.description: The id of the environment to which the condition set belongs.

id.description: A unique id by which Permit will identify the condition set. The key will be used as the generated rego rule name.

key.description: A unique id by which Permit will identify the condition set. The key will be used as the generated rego rule name.

name.description: A descriptive name for the set, i.e: 'US based employees' or 'Users behind VPN'

organization_id.description: The id of the organization to which the condition set belongs.

project_id.description: The id of the project to which the condition set belongs.

block.description: See the [our documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Condition-Sets/operation/create_condition_set) for more information on condition sets.

created_at.description: The creation timestamp. This is a timestamp for when the object was created.

description.description: The description. This is a human-readable description for the object.

environment_id.description: The environment ID. This is a unique identifier for the environment.

extends.description: list of role keys that define what roles this role extends. In other words: this role will automatically inherit all the permissions of the given roles in this list.

id.description: The resource ID. This is a unique identifier for the resource.

key.description: The key. This is a unique identifier.

name.description: The name. This is a human-readable name for the object.

organization_id.description: The organization ID. This is a unique identifier for the organization.

permissions.description: list of action keys that define what actions this resource role is permitted to do

project_id.description: The project ID. This is a unique identifier for the project.

resource.description: The unique resource key that the role belongs to.

resource_id.description: The unique resource ID that the role belongs to.

updated_at.description: The update timestamp. This is a timestamp for when the object was last updated.

block.description:
See [the documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Resources/operation/create_resource) for more information about roles.
 You can also read about Resource Roles [here](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Resource-Roles/operation/create_resource_role).

linked_by.description: The relation that links the resource to the role.

on_resource.description: The resource that the user will derive the role on.

resource.description: Either the unique id of the resource, or the URL-friendly key of the resource that you want to create role derivation for.

role.description: The role that the user will derive.

to_role.description: The role that you want to create role derivation for.

block.description: See [the documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Implicit-Grants/operation/create_implicit_grant) for more information on role derivations.

conditions.description: a boolean expression that consists of multiple conditions, with and/or logic.

description.description: an optional longer description of the set

environment_id.description: The id of the environment to which the condition set belongs.

id.description: A unique id by which Permit will identify the condition set. The key will be used as the generated rego rule name.

key.description: A unique id by which Permit will identify the condition set. The key will be used as the generated rego rule name.

name.description: A descriptive name for the set, i.e: 'US based employees' or 'Users behind VPN'

organization_id.description: The id of the organization to which the condition set belongs.

project_id.description: The id of the project to which the condition set belongs.

resource.description: The resource id to which the condition set applies. This is only required for resource sets.

block.description: See the [our documentation](https://api.permit.io/v2/redoc#tag/Condition-Sets/operation/create_condition_set) for more information on condition sets.
